snippet: A new book called “30 Lessons for Living” draws from interviews with more than 1,000 older Americans from different economic, educational and occupational strata.
abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column reviews advice drawn from interviews with more than 1,000 older Americans and collected in book 30 Lessons for Living by Karl Pillemer.
lead_paragraph: A new book called “30 Lessons for Living” draws from interviews with more than 1,000 older Americans from different economic, educational and occupational strata.

headline.seo: Elderly ‘Experts’ Share Life Advice in Cornell Project
headline.main: Advice From Life’s Graying Edge on Finishing With No Regrets
headline.print_headline: Advice From Life’s Graying Edge on Finishing With No Regrets
